arm_group.description: All patients belong to the same group Description includes the surgical technique

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood samples collected to measure Anti-Mullerian hormone levels

brief_summary.textblock:
Anti-Mullerian hormone (AMH) is a marker for ovarian reserve.  It is well known that ovarian
      surgery for endometriosis lowers Anti-Mullerian hormone, but little is known for other
      surgeries.  We seek to investigate the hormone variations before and after an open
      myomectomy.

      Hypothesis: Anti-Mullerian hormone levels drop following surgery but return to normal levels
      in a few months

clinical_study.brief_title: Anti-Mullerian Hormone Levels Before and After an Open Myomectomy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  18 to 42 years old

          -  Requiring open myomectomy for any indication

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Incapable of informed consent

          -  Use of hormonal contraception or Gonadotropin-releasing hormone agonists in the past
             3 months

          -  Woman over 42 years old

          -  Post-menopause women

          -  Positive B-human chorionic gonadotropin the day of surgery

          -  Ovarian surgery (at the same time)

          -  Pre-operative AMH below 0.3 ng/mL

study_pop.textblock: Women 18 to 42 tears old Indication for myomectomy by laparotomy

clinical_study.official_title: Anti-Mullerian Hormone Levels Variations Following an Open Myomectomy

overall_official.affiliation: Centre Hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal

primary_outcome.description: Anti-Mullerian Hormone levels before and 6 months after surgery

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
